Description: Shoulder fragment of black-figured pottery closed vase, perhaps oenochoe. Beardless head in profile to left; face below the eye painted red; dilute band and glazed area above.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 120, no. 339.4, pl. XXXVII)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 232, no. 176)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.069) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5743 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
